qas.question: In what years did the Great Famine occur?
What period resulted in poor weather that increased crop failures?
What period preceded the Little Ice Age?
Along with 1317–21, what span saw extreme rains in Europe?
In what century did the European average annual temperature decrease?

context: The first years of the 14th century were marked by famines, culminating in the Great Famine of <a0_0>1315–17<a0_0/>. The causes of the Great Famine included the slow transition from <a2_0>the Medieval Warm Period<a2_0/> to <a1_0>the Little Ice Age<a1_0/>, which left the population vulnerable when bad weather caused crop failures. The years <a3_0>1313–14<a3_0/> and 1317–21 were excessively rainy throughout Europe, resulting in widespread crop failures. The climate change—which resulted in a declining average annual temperature for Europe during the <a4_0>14th<a4_0/> century—was accompanied by an economic downturn.
